subject: Editing an event that was assigned to me

comments.value: I was assigned an event to review by Tom Farley (Hip Hop Shakespeare Competition Othello Retold). He said he couldn't get the date to display as 31 October (it would only be 1 Oct). I followed the link in my inbox and made an amend to the page, but when I tried to save changes the 'saving changes' thing kept twirling, didn't save the changes.
Think this is duplicated elsewhere and quite possibly resolved ages ago.

subject: Business suppliers - fixes

comments.value:
Hi Jamie Can you advise when the following amends can be done for the 'ODA suppliers' in the Business Network? We need these to be working asap as we need to go live with the data on 4 November (so need it working beginning of next week really). - Olympic Stadium suppliers that you had removed, reinstating them 'in progress' (not published) - there were about 100 of them. - Being able save suppliers with the same name - as some suppliers provide more than one business to us and so will appear in more than one category. - In the dropdowns for region - all regions need to appear whether there are companies under those or not. If there are none, when you select it none should appear. - In IE6 the constituency dropdown needs fixing so it is wider and shows the full name. If you could let me know when these can be done by that would be great. Thanks Alex
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

> - Olympic Stadium suppliers that you had removed, 
> reinstating them ‘in progress’ (not published) – there were about 
> 100 of them.

Hi Alex,

Can you remind me what they were? was it all under a particular sector?

> - Being able save suppliers with the same name – as some 
> suppliers provide more than one business to us and so will appear in 
> more than one category.

Unlikely we can get this in place in the current CMS within the week 
(we also have 1000 days to go image upload to set-up and test this 
week and a site to redesign)

It is fixed in the new CMS / redesigned site (in fact just working on 
suppliers in the redesigned site at the moment)

> - In the dropdowns for region – all regions need to appear 
> whether there are companies under those or not. If there are none, 
> when you select it none should appear.

Sure, no problem..

> - In IE6 the constituency dropdown needs fixing so it is 
> wider and shows the full name.

This is a bug * in IE / the design of the site, not the CMS, there 
isn't really a sensible fix

* I say bug, it's actually Microsoft's intended browser behaviour

Lars did try the solutions below, but they cause odd behaviour and 
aren't the panacea they seem to be.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/682764/select-dropdown-with-fixed-width-cutting-off-content-in-ie

If you look elsewhere on the site you find this is pretty standard and 
how the mark-up was originally coded by LBi

I know it might seem crazy, but it is default behaviour in IE, your 
boxes can wither be really long or cropped, you can't have one that is 
cropped till you select it at which point it expands to the full width.

Jamie

> If you could let me know when these can be done by that would be 
> great.
>
> Thanks
>
> Alex
>
>
> This message is confidential to the ordinary user of the email 
> address to which it was addressed. It may also be privileged or 
> otherwise protected by other legal rules. If you have received it by 
> mistake please let us know by reply and then immediately delete it 
> from your system. You should not copy, disclose or forward its 
> contents to anyone. No representation or warranty as to the absence 
> of viruses in the e-mail or any attachments is made by the sender.
> http://www.london2012.com
>
>

Thanks Jamie

 

The suppliers you removed all had the 'contractor' as Olympic Stadium,
whereas the ones on the live site now are all ODA suppliers. I can't
remember why you removed them, but I can dig out an old email if
necessary?

 

If we can't save suppliers with the same name, is it possible to be able
to add more than one 'service' (if you see the data-> supplier form it
is one of the options). E.g for the company 'Aggregate Industries which
I'm just adding now their services are:

 

Flexible Surfacing

Aggregates

Surfacing Works inc Footbridge, flexiable, Red Sand & Anti Skid

Ready Mixed Concrete

 

Also, as they supply to more than one 'Contractor' we'd need to be able
to add more than one contractor so they appear when you try and filter
them....

 

So in other word, can we add more than one:

 

'Contractor' - so if a company's page is filled in that they supply to
the 'Aquatics Centre and 'Olympic Stadium' when you filter by each using
the contractor dropdown, it should appear in two places?

 

'Service' - this isn't affected in the filtering but may make the box on
live stretched - is this a problem?

 

Happy to talk through on the phone if this doesn't make sense!
Screengrabs below.

 

Thanks


Alex

 

 

 

Contractor filtering:

 

 

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com] 
Sent: 20 October 2009 15:22
To: Alexandra Brown
Cc: support@postcms.zendesk.com
Subject: Re: Business suppliers - fixes

 

> - Olympic Stadium suppliers that you had removed, 

> reinstating them 'in progress' (not published) - there were about 

> 100 of them.

 

Hi Alex,

 

Can you remind me what they were? was it all under a particular sector?

 

> - Being able save suppliers with the same name - as some 

> suppliers provide more than one business to us and so will appear in 

> more than one category.

 

Unlikely we can get this in place in the current CMS within the week 

(we also have 1000 days to go image upload to set-up and test this 

week and a site to redesign)

 

It is fixed in the new CMS / redesigned site (in fact just working on 

suppliers in the redesigned site at the moment)

 

> - In the dropdowns for region - all regions need to appear 

> whether there are companies under those or not. If there are none, 

> when you select it none should appear.

 

Sure, no problem..

 

> - In IE6 the constituency dropdown needs fixing so it is 

> wider and shows the full name.

 

This is a bug * in IE / the design of the site, not the CMS, there 

isn't really a sensible fix

 

* I say bug, it's actually Microsoft's intended browser behaviour

 

Lars did try the solutions below, but they cause odd behaviour and 

aren't the panacea they seem to be.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/682764/select-dropdown-with-fixed-wid
th-cutting-off-content-in-ie

 

If you look elsewhere on the site you find this is pretty standard and 

how the mark-up was originally coded by LBi

 

I know it might seem crazy, but it is default behaviour in IE, your 

boxes can wither be really long or cropped, you can't have one that is 

cropped till you select it at which point it expands to the full width.

 

Jamie

 

> If you could let me know when these can be done by that would be 

> great.

description:
Hi Jamie Can you advise when the following amends can be done for the 'ODA suppliers' in the Business Network? We need these to be working asap as we need to go live with the data on 4 November (so need it working beginning of next week really). - Olympic Stadium suppliers that you had removed, reinstating them 'in progress' (not published) - there were about 100 of them. - Being able save suppliers with the same name - as some suppliers provide more than one business to us and so will appear in more than one category. - In the dropdowns for region - all regions need to appear whether there are companies under those or not. If there are none, when you select it none should appear. - In IE6 the constituency dropdown needs fixing so it is wider and shows the full name. If you could let me know when these can be done by that would be great. Thanks Alex

subject: Some tag updates

comments.value:
Hiya,

 

Can we please change the following:

 

In the themes metatags, could we please change 'Culture' to 'Cultural
Olympiad'?

In the organisation metatags, could we please change BOA to 'British
Olympic Association (BOA)' and the BPA to 'British Paralympic
Association (BPA)'

 

I don't think that my management of the tag cloud allows for those
changes to work - I tried to rename BOA in the tag management tool, and
it doesn't seem to have picked up in the pages...

 

Thanks!

 

Liz

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com <http://www.london2012.com> 

www.twitter.com/london2012team

 


The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 
 
This E-mail is confidential. If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return

Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com
<hr width="100%">

By "tags" we mean only free-form tags, of the kind that are typed in as comma-separated values in the "Tags" input. Other metadata fields are not tags, and are not handled in the tag management UI. It's important everybody over there understand this or you're likely to get odd results where tags are "not working"!

The theme metadata field is autocompleted from a fixed taxonomy. We can change the value stored in the taxonomy, but this will not change existing values. Let us know if you want these old values changed retrospectively.

subject: Image publish error

comments.value:
Hi

I'm getting the attached error when I try to publish user uploaded images in the CMS.

Thanks

Alex

Hi Alex,

Is this happening on all videos? the extension on that image looks wrong (.pjpeg)

This is obv. a bug but wondered if it's a red herrign or the root of the problem (ie. are other images fine)

thanks

btw. we are rewriting all this code for the redesigned site, so although we obviously need to iron out serious bugs, it may make sense for us to put effort into getting it working on the redesigned site rather than fixing the current code (*obviously* serious bugs need fixing on the current site, and not being able to publish sounds pretty serious to me - I was more referring to the case that this is just due to the wrong extension)

I think that the page IS being published properly, but that the approval screen is then trying to reload it but ... can't because it has (necessarily) been moved from:
 news/images/uploads/uploaded-photo-2009-09-29-18-57-32.pjpeg
to
 Photos/Resized/2009/10/14/fullsize
Am checking with Michael what we can do about this.

description:

I'm getting the attached error when I try to publish user uploaded images in the CMS.

Thanks

Alex

subject: FW: Broken link to Greenwich info

comments.value:
Can you help me work out why the link to the Greenwich park document
isn't working?

 

Thank you

 

________________________________

From: Esther Swales [mailto:Esther.Swales@greenwich.gov.uk] 
Sent: 21 October 2009 12:12
To: Deborah Elstein
Subject: Broken link to Greenwich info

 

Hello Deborah, 

Greenwich Council would like to link to a recent LOCOG publication on
Greenwich Park but the link is broken on this page:

http://www.london2012.com/news/publications/index.php
<http://www.london2012.com/news/publications/index.php> 

Please could you advise? 

Many thanks 
Esther 

Esther Swales 
Website Editorial Manager 
www.greenwich.gov.uk <file:///\\www.greenwich.gov.uk> 
020 8921 5074

The link was not working because the PDF document had not been published despite the fact that you had published the associated Publication Listing. The same problem has arisen with the recently-published LOCOG Sustainable Sourcing Code. Both publications have now been published manually, but this does look like a workflow issue that might still need attention (although it is possible that it has been fixed since the document was originally published on October 12th).

Thanks

 

Please confirm when you've checked whether the workflow works as would
make sense (ie when you upload a publication through the 'data' tab, and
press publish, it does actually publish)

subject: Renaming webcam

comments.value:
Hi We have recently moved our Olympic Stadium webcam 3 to the Main Press Centre. Can I just rename it here or will that mess things up? Basically the Stadium camera needs renaming to Main Press Centre. Thanks Alex Alexandra Brown Marketing Executive (New Media) Communications Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

Alex I have tracked down a couple off dependencies that might make renaming the page inadvisable.

We have a feed running (TimelaseCameras) once an hour, which collects images from Site-Eye Live and names the pages to which these images are saved.

While it would be relatively simple to edit this feed, the second dependency is the Stamen timelapse overlay. If we change the name of the page in the feed, it will create a new page, which would would be likely to interfere with Stamen's ability to capture the data for the new camera.

A simpler solution might be to just change the copy on the page below the image, or--as you have already done--take the image off line for now.

It would make more sense to look at this post-launch, I think.

Hi Danny

 

It's fine in that I can remove the timelapse.

 

In terms of renaming, the feed doesn't need renaming, but the page does.
As all we have done is moved the location of the camera from Stadium to
MPC. It is still the same feed, but a different location so it just
needs to be renamed.


So in other words, don't need to touch the feed name, just the page
name...


Alex

 

________________________________

From: Danny Sofer [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 18 November 2009 12:02
To: Alexandra Brown
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Renaming webcam

Hi Danny

Just to confirm here is the exact link to the new camera (I'm sure this is the old Stadium camera 3 link).

http://www.siteeyelive.com/monitor/london2012/camputer128.jpg

Please could you prioritise this first thing? We really want to send the camera link out with a press release by 10am ideally.

The page just needs to be called Main Press Centre.

Thanks

Alex

PS - I'm on 07971 465885 if you need to speak to me

I would like Earls Court and Greenwich Park to appear in the left nav of
the Planning Consultations section. 

 

I've created two blank pages in 'planning consultations' in making it
happen called Earls Court and Greenwich park. (they're unpublished).
Could you publish them, and set up redirects so that they go to the
Greenwich Park microsite
(http://www.london2012.com/greenwich-park/home.html) and the Earls Court
one (http://www.london2012.com/earls-court/home.html) 

 

I promise not to skirt the preferred route too often!

 

Liz

Liz, you should be able to do this yourself. Instead of creating pages of type "Generic content", create pages of type "Redirect". Then open each page up in the editor and edit the metadata field MyUrl.

Well, that's highly exciting! I've given it a whirl. :-)

Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: i know it should be in pivotal but...

Hi Liz,

Seems like this is already working?

Noticed you used the new Redirect template ;-)

One word of warning this should only be used if you want the redirect 
appearing in the navigation, for most redirects (ie. short urls) it 
would be better if the redirects lived in the redirect file.

Jamie

Can we do regular short urls ourselves??!! What do we do, exactly?

 

Liz Goulding

Janos

notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com> wrote:

description:
I'm getting political pressure. :-/

 

I would like Earls Court and Greenwich Park to appear in the left nav of
the Planning Consultations section. 

 

I've created two blank pages in 'planning consultations' in making it
happen called Earls Court and Greenwich park. (they're unpublished).
Could you publish them, and set up redirects so that they go to the
Greenwich Park microsite
(http://www.london2012.com/greenwich-park/home.html) and the Earls Court
one (http://www.london2012.com/earls-court/home.html) 

 

I promise not to skirt the preferred route too often!

 

Liz

Hi all Thanks for the drinks and food last night - was fun! And great choice of bar again :-) Please can you set it up so I can add user accounts in the CMS? Need to set people up today...
